org.jetel.component

Class Sort

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Node
        • org.jetel.component.Sort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IGraphElement, CloverWorkerListener

    public class Sort
extends Node

    Sort Component

    Component:

    Name:

    		 Sort

    Category:

    Description:

    		 Sorts the incoming records based on specified key.
    The key is name (or combination of names) of field(s) from input record. The sort order is either Ascending (default) or Descending.

    Inputs:

    		 [0]- input records

    Outputs:

    		 At least one connected output port.

    Comment:

    XML attributes:
    type"SORT"
    idcomponent identification
    sortKeyfield names separated by :;| {colon, semicolon, pipe}
    sortOrder
    optional    		one of "Ascending|Descending" {the fist letter is sufficient, if not defined, then Ascending}
    useI18N
    optional    		true/false perform sorting according to national rules - e.g. Czech or German handling of characters like "i","??". Default is false.
    Use it only if you are sorting data according to key which can contain accented characters or you want sorter to follow certain locale specific rules.
    locale
    optional    		locale to be used when sorting using I18N rules. If not specified, then system default is used.
    Example: "fr"

    Example:

    <Node id="SORT_CUSTOMER" type="SORT" sortKey="Name:Address" sortOrder="A"/>
    <Node id="SORT_CUSTOMER" type="SORT" sortKey="Name:Address" sortOrder="A" useI18N="true" locale="fr"/>
    Since:
    April 4, 2002

    • Method Detail

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class Node
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.
        Specified by:
        free in interface IGraphElement
